medical_history.chief_complaint: Moderate hypercalcemia with suspected primary hyperparathyroidism.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient, a 60-year-old woman, presented with symptoms of nonspecific bone pain, arthralgia, hand paresthesias, muscle cramps, soreness of the eyes, and insomnia. The symptoms have progressed to the point of clinical attention, with initial elevation in serum calcium levels noted during evaluation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient underwent an unsuccessful parathyroidectomy prior to this visit. No other relevant medical history is specified.
medical_history.family_history: Family history of asymptomatic hypercalcemia and confirmed cases of familial benign hypocalciuric hypercalcemia (FBHH) in other family members.
